text.0: he slays the foe and wins the spoil who worships indra and agni strong and mighty heroes.
text.1: who rule as sovrans over ample riches victorious showing forth their power in conquest.
text.2: so battle now o indra and thou agni for cows and waters sunlight stolen mornings.
text.3: teamborne thou makest kine thine own o agni thou indra light dawns regions wondrous waters.
text.4: with vṛtraslaying might indra and agni come drawn by homage o ye vṛtraslayers.
text.5: indra and agni show yourselves among us with your supreme and unrestricted bounties.
text.6: i call the twain whose deeds of old have all been famed in ancient days.
text.8: the strong the scatterers of the foe indra and agni we invoke.
text.9: may they be kind to one like me.
text.10: they slay our Ārya foes these lords of heroes slay our dasyu foes.
text.12: indra and agni these our songs of praise have sounded forth to you.
text.13: ye who bring blessings drink the juice.
text.14: come indraagni with those teams desired of many which ye have.
text.16: with those to this libation poured ye heroes indraagni come.
text.17: come ye to drink the soma juice.
text.18: glorify him who compasses all forests with his glowing flame.
text.19: and leaves them blackened with his tongue.
text.20: he who gains indras bliss with fire enkindled finds an easy way.
text.22: give us fleet coursers to convey indra and agni and bestow.
text.24: indra and agni i will call you hither and make you joyful with the gifts i offer.
text.25: ye twain are givers both of food and riches to win me strength and vigour i invoke you.
text.26: come unto us with riches come with wealth in horses and in kine.
text.27: indra and agni we invoke you both the gods as friends for friendship bringing bliss.
text.28: indra and agni hear his call who worships with libations poured.
text.29: come and enjoy the offerings drink the sweetlyflavoured soma juice.
